name_full: Acute encephalopathy with biphasic seizures and restricted diffusion

Presence of encephalopathy by clinical exam
Diffusion restriction of subcortical white matter on day 3-14
Relative sparing of pre/post central gyrus, restricted diffusion in cortex
Early seizure with fever on days 1-2 with recurrence of seizures on day 3-7

questions.help_text:
Shock defined as organ and tissue hypoperfusion despite preserved intravascular volume, typically manifesting as hypotension with vasopressor
requirement and lactic acidosis

CSF neopterines or quinolinic acid if available

options: type 1, no bands in CSF and serum
type 2, oligoclonal IgG bands in CSF
type 3, oligoclonal bands in CSF and serum with additional bands in CSF
type 4, identical oligoclonal bands in CSF and serum
type 5, monoclonal bands in CSF and serum
